This song is basically a warning. People who want to become famous sell their souls to the Illuminati. Because they have spiritual influences that can rope in thousands of countless people into listening and following them. As if it's like following a religion.  Those artists and actors who have millions of views aren't just from physical and talented influences, it's spiritual influences too sadly. Why do you think so many celebrities end up with drug addictions, have been to jail, have known to have sex with anyone bc they felt like it, and have mental health issues? Because they have realized this lifestyle that so many people idolize and worship isn't worth paying the price for. And that is their soul and how they live their life. They are basically, as Dax described it, "a puppet for the puppeteer(Lucifer) to use for evil intentions". And in the end, "when the puppet breaks, the puppeteer(Lucifer) throws it away". As if they never existed. Why do you think in the K-pop industry so many fans are obsessed with just a person? Or a couple of people? It's not normal to be undeniably obsessed with someone just because they are hot. There's nothing wrong with a celebrity crush, but that type of obsession shows they are something satanic (at least in my opinion) influencing it. Please people be careful around these celebrities today. I honestly don't know if they are human anymore from what I've discovered. But, hopefully, these people will stand up for themselves and get out of the lifestyle, or they might die trying. I do not think these people are our friends, but that doesn't mean we shouldn't pray for them. And people please be careful what type of music, movies, or just entertainment you let in your life bc they either have good or bad influences. And to be honest, if you really think about it, you discover the meanings of these words.  Entertainment: "Enter" in your life-"Tain" taint the innocent-"Ment" Take up every moment. Television: Tell-a-Vision Other Definitions that really show the truth: "delight"- in good or bad "distraction,"-to keep you away from goals and achievements "diversion,"- to divide people from loving and respecting each other "pleasure,"- to enjoy the pleasures of the flesh (porn which creates addictions, NSFW ASMR, fanfiction, books, tv shows like Euphoria and Riverdale, etc.) "recreation." is the action or process of creating something again. To change something or someone completely.   If yall want more evidence I recommend DuckDuckgo.com bc they haven't filtered through this kind of stuff, but I'm telling y'all, if y'all don't believe me, that is completely fine. But if you are interested, I will warn you, once you learn the truth, you will be wiser, but some things may never look the same again. Just ask God for guidance, and if you are not a believer, just ask for him to help you. He will listen. I promise you. All you have to do is ask ğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜‰ God bless you, friend. Dax,  Wow. Just f@#$ing WOW. New fan here, as a result of this song at this very moment. I've heard of you before and heard only few songs - "My heart hurts" and just before this I watched "Joker" which led me here to "Gotham." I gotta say man - I relate to a lot of what you're saying in your lyrics. To put it bluntly - your shit is deep. I don't know if you actually read any of the comments people write you but if you happen to read this know that your art & your voice is important in ways you can't imagine or possibly see. I don't really know anything about you but as a composer, producer & artist I can tell by your delivery, lyricism & content that you have been doing this sh!t for awhile and I know it ain't easy to get personal on a track but this sh!t feels hella personal. And that's exactly why you have a new fan. I'm excited that amid all the fake, vapid, self-centered "artists" out there that seem to be multiplying like Gremlins and wreaking havoc in the minds and ears and eyes of the people, there are real lyricists and artists out there that are talking about shit that actually matters. As a struggling artist it is very tempting to make and produce content that is commercially viable yet full of sh!t because it is so easy it's laughable and there is a very real demand for it, oddly. (I know you know what i'm talking about.) But when you've been doing it as long as I have the only real choice is to produce and create stuff that is honest and from the heart - even if it remains in obscurity. I'm truly pleased to come across an artist like you who is using their platform to express ideas that mean something & I hope you continue to find success. I'll be bumping your shit in the meantime and looking forward to hearing whatever else you have to say and watching your growth as an artist. Mad props Dax, I know the hard work, dedication, time and sacrifice that goes into following your dreams and it ain't for the weak of heart. We see you, Dog, and you deserve much respect without a doubt.  Thanks for keeping it real and making yourself vulnerable. F@#$ the haters.  - -[Tekorji]

I can't say I want to be famous, but I do want to do something worthwhile and fun. I want to be a voice actor. Even if it's a small role no one ever notices, I'd be content. I've no idea where to even begin with that, though. I'm so disconnected from reality, because the last decade has been a fever dream of chaos and I don't know where all that time went. So sometimes, I stream on Twitch for fun and to give myself an outlet to be a little weirdo. I don't have a webcam, or fancy screen animations or overlays. Hell, I barely know how to operate Streamlabs at all, but my channel is starting to do surprisingly well. I'm not gonna plug it. I'm not making a comment to promote myself. But I do fear the idea that I might get famous one day, and my whole life will be on show and I'll have no where to hide. I mean, I just want the fun, not the attention. I know it's an inevitability you can't escape. No public figure can. I've watched a lot of my idols go through some tough shit, and I remember Eminem's "The Way I Am" and how all he wanted was to just be left the fuck alone but people hounded him everywhere he went.  But if someone gave me a chance to get my foot in the door as a voice actor? I'd probably jump on it even though I know what it would bring. That's the cost of following your dreams.

My brother asked me to listen to this song a few minutes ago. He asked that i really listen & said he wanted my honest opinion.. telling me he had something he wanted to actually discuss, is what I knew he meant. ğŸ™„Okay. Fine. Whatever. He knows I really dislike this genre of music, for one. Even the blend I would rather consider this to be.. all of it. Not my thing really. But it's not on my "play that shit & I will burn your face off while holding the match with my teeth" list. That award, primarily, goes to anything country. And I'm of the generation who constantly heard "do u want me to give u something to cry about!?" So im.. yeah.. I don't have the patience. I give my brothers new like a listen because, at least, it isn't the same guy he's been on about for weeks on end & who I used to really like until my brother got ahold of it.ğŸ™„ I usually listen to ppl who the world hasn't yet heard of because I'm bored. I don't have twitter, instagram or any of that (snap but only because i won't give the kids service & i can monitor their every move, deleted or not). I like things that are controversial, clever, thought provoking.. i really like things that make me jump to one emotion or another until you give it a listen or 2 & it's not what it seemed. Or maybe it speaks to both sides of... (something no one does anymore because one of us is right and the other should be flogged) idk. I don't listen to music much anymore. Mostly news. I like stories. Real stories. People's stories. Not the crowd that's "woke" or right, or who can admit they were wrong, not the ones who are 1/16th Cherokee/blk/hispanic/white (whatever pc thing they need in the moment). I like stories that don't end with blame (unless it's to recognize our own so that we csn do something about it, not true- we can't and we dont even almost want to either)..  All of this to say, what u wrote here.. in this.. is none of what i find anymore. After the 1st 15 times thru it is.... So much of what it isn't. And almost exactly as it shouldn't be. I really enjoyed it. And now that I'm aware that you exist I very much look forward to listening to you further

I honestly would rather not be famous. I like the idea of owning a brand that's famous. But I don't want my person to be famous due to how unhappy people who themselves are famous seem to be. I don't want to be swarmed when I go into public. I'd rather be a ghost among the population especially with anxiety disorders it's just a nightmare to be famous famous.  If I could make games and publish them under a brand and watch people enjoy my games and know I'm financially stable so I can escape a 9-5; that's my dream.  And I only work with friends because of this. Other people will just cut you down to get what they want. And I've experienced that in a studio environment and it just tore the passion and joy game development gave me. It was a nightmare.   If I can have a place to live and food to eat while making games; that's all I want. Whether that requires fame or not isn't much of a concern and preferably not.
Consumed by the algorithm, it becomes clear.  Life's a simulation all controlled by a puppeteer.  Blind people leading blind people driving cars to a destination that is unclear, while they can't steer.    I'm shook.

Hi I'm a 13 year old white boy who loves to rap. I know that might sound corny, but hear me out. I've been freestyling since 8. I do it for like 2-3 hours a day. Music is an escape from all sorts of problems for all types of people.  No one knows about my passion except a few close friends,  not even my parents.  I'd honestly say I'm quite versatile, I rap on all types of beats. I'm  also a decent storyteller. I've been writing songs for like a year. But my problem is that I live in Poland(I speak fluent English,  I moved to here at 11), and I really want to make it to the US. I just want some advice for future life, and if this work I put in is even worth it. Thanks, if you want to send me a dm or something I can give you my Instagram.

But at the same time it is what spreads your message and other people trying to escape from the authoritarianism of Gotham. You were so on point with this project. We shutdown because of Covid which brings millions out of jobs, and millions on the streets. Other countries didn't shutdown and their economy was fine, and they had barely any deaths. Yet we still trust our government. And look up to the powerful who don't give a fuck about humanity. The saddest part of this whole song is when the news headline said batman saved you. You tried to fight off "gotham" but lost and batman rescued you. This tells me that in "gotham" the modern corupt society we live in, normal people can't be heroes. I love this itâ€™s amazing ğŸ¤©
Some decent points regarding how vacuous fame is.  Of course most of the people you're criticising have no substance - that's a given, but the problem is not that Dax is undervalued as some fans are claiming here - it's simply that those at the top are over inflated. Their cultural value is grossly over estimated.  The fact that Dax would gladly switch places with those who enjoy greater influence than him invalidates his stance.   There are some artists out there making good hip hop for grown adults, who have been grinding for years with a much smaller following than the likes of Dax.  Good writers whose lines and ideas stand up to scrutiny.  There's something insincere about a grown man claiming depth for ideas designed to resonate with a teenage audience.  In some ways those that don't claim to have any real substance are perhaps more honest.

Gotham isn't a 'place.' At least not in the figure of speech Dax is using it. It's a 'mindset' that everyone is in. And it was the mindset he is in (and possibly still is, due to his recent stories and posts hinting that he isn't "ready" just yet). It's the era of where everyone is captivated by the same old shit. Where no one pays attention to the, as Dax put it in Killshot 2, "the shit people need that'll actually make a motherfucking difference." Where people are powerless. The things people say and do to get clout and fame. Whether it be famous in school, popular in town, or the next level.

Dax becoming Prince EA
Hi
On the 30/06/2020 my younger sister Olebea Sinclair (Crissana) died under tragic circumstances. She was only 28 yrs old leaving 3 kids behind. On that day when I came home and saw her life less body on the ground I started crying and from then on I never stop shedding tears. I lost apart of me and I keep praying and hoping that one day I may find the strength I need to heal the continuous pain am feeling inside daily. I have been doing music over 15 yrs so i did this tribute to her life and memories, this has been the easiest and hardest song I've ever did. Take a few minutes to watch this video and listen. Feel free to leave a comment like and share. THANK YOU!!  Produced by K.M.T/ O.N.P Distributed by hapilos21 Video @xavieproduction #cry #ripcrissana #sip #heaven   https://youtu.be/fNH2RPTPlHE
